content: @Mark Drobnak @Zahari Dichev or anyone, I'll put a few things that you might interested in working on here
On mobile right now, so not going to be fully written out for now
But I can at least iterate a few things
So https://github.com/rust-lang/chalk/issues/313 is still open. It's somewhat explanatory on the issue, but I can explain more later if there are questions
https://github.com/rust-lang/chalk/issues/429 looks like a recursive solver issue, but also looks like it interacts with associated types
(Side thought, maybe we should have an issue tag for slg, recursive, solve, etc.)
There is this https://github.com/rust-lang/chalk/issues/234
Which is firmly under the "hard" category
I have a couple branches where I attempted to fix this
But when we talked about it last with @nikomatsakis, we discussed possibly approaching this using a concept called equivalent edges
But I think the idea is also somewhat related to the semantic to syntactic equality
And treating the projection equal type as an inference variable of sorts
This PR by @Florian Diebold needs to be dug into a little https://github.com/rust-lang/chalk/issues/234
Sorry. https://github.com/rust-lang/chalk/pull/331
In particular, I think there might be somewhat wrong with MayInvalidate
(Where the evidence for that is even with the change, a separate issue pops up)
@detrumi seems busy or stuck on https://github.com/rust-lang/chalk/pull/402
But it would be cool to figure out what needs to be done there and get it finished
It would be nice to get this finished https://github.com/rust-lang/chalk/pull/407
With this https://github.com/rust-lang/chalk/pull/409 the next thing to do is just write docs so we know how to use it
(Also are the zulip thread for other relevant discussion)
Anyone should feel free to redo the lifetime outlives PR based on @nikomatsakis's branch since it might be a few more days before I can get around to it
While not as "fun", there is https://github.com/rust-lang/chalk/issues/398
Then there's https://github.com/rust-lang/chalk/issues/327
Which is somewhat blocked on design. But maybe we just mimic what rustc does
Okay, let's start with that
Thanks, this is great!
the hard one seems quite tempting but .. i think it will be a bit too hard for me
The thing that makes it hard it mostly just that it's a somewhat of a design problem

Hi, I am wondering if any of those are like "good first issue"? I think I am comfortable with Rust, so I think I will catch up rather quickly, and I read a little about chalk so I have an idea how it works, but I never went into this deeper. I am debating on https://github.com/rust-lang/chalk/issues/313 or maybe https://github.com/rust-lang/chalk/pull/409 (as writing docs might be a way to understand internals).
@Bartłomiej Kuras Hmm so the docs for tracing wouldn't be bad
https://github.com/rust-lang/chalk/pull/407 is also fairly easy (and doesn't really require deep knowledge about Chalk)
I will take https://github.com/rust-lang/chalk/pull/407 for now as you propose it - I will go through issue at later evening. Thanks!
Let me know if you have any questions :)
Sure - I will take a look in llike 2-3 hours (when I would put my kids to beds) so I would raise questions when I would go through whatever is there ;)
@Santiago Pastorino are you interested in helping out on the rustc side or the Chalk side?
actually, let's have that discussion in a different topic :) If you want to help out, I want to help get you pointed in a direction :)
I guess as a start in whatever needs to be done
Hmm, so you might be potentially interested in/a good fit to do some things related to the rustc_type_ir crate
In particular I think the problem we were about to run into is Encodable/TyEncodable
And coherence issues
Let me try to find the relevant comment by @Matthew Jasper
I can't find it :(
Maybe if was on zulip
one sec
yes: https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/144729-wg-traits/topic/type.20library.20discussion/near/219906490
oops s/TyEncodable/TyDecodable
wait both
ok, what needs to be done with that?
I can probably check a bit better tomorrow
I'm leaving right now
Yeah, I don't quite know
But, essentially, there are million and a half types in rustc_middle that derive TyEncodable and/or TyDecodable that will need to be moved to rustc_type_ir
And the question is how do we handle this
I think it's possible that at this point we have to introduce the Interner in rustc_type_ir and also split out a tcx.interner() from tcx

By the way, #79951 is still waiting on review. Fortunately it didn't get as many conflicts as I was expecting, but it would be great if someone had time to review it. Current reviewer is nikomatsakis, but maybe they are busy and I should try to find another reviewer?
Yeah Niko definitely doesn't have a lot of time. Maybe post in t-compiler and see if anyone wants to take over the review. It's pretty straightforward.
Right, it's just moving things around
hey, sorry that I never got back to you guys
I'm currently on vacations for a couple of weeks
once I'm back I'm going to check this and what else there's to do
cc @Jack Huey
No worries @Santiago Pastorino
I think what I said about (re. TyEncodable etc.) still holds and probably won't change (anyone someone else picks it up)
But enjoy your vacation and we can discuss when you're back
@Jack Huey I am interested in picking that one up. And anything else that helps move things along. Would be great to get some more info on the context whenever possible
@Zahari Dichev hmm, so will you be around any time the upcoming week? I won't be around much this weekend for sync chat, but can schedule something this week and we can discuss
I will try to write up some mentoring notes here; but, this is also somewhat in the "I'm not quite sure what needs to do be done here" category

In short: We need to move things into rustc_type_ir. A lot of types impl Encodable/Decodable, some through the TyEncodable/TyDecodable derive. There are two problems here: 1) Encodable/Decodable needs to be moved to or upstream of rustc_type_ir 2) TyEncodable/TyDecodable needs TyCtxt which is in rustc_middle, so we need to figure out a way around the coherence here. (It might mean defining an "Interner" trait that we split out of TyCtxt
I imagine in some cases we could just impl from rustc_middle on types from rustc_type_ir, but doesn't work with private fields and such.
(FWIW, {En,De}codable are defined in rustc_serialize)

Jack Huey said:

I imagine in some cases we could just impl from rustc_middle on types from rustc_type_ir, but doesn't work with private fields and such.

I guess if something may need to be encoded, it shouldn't be private, right?

Léo Lanteri Thauvin said:

Jack Huey said:

I imagine in some cases we could just impl from rustc_middle on types from rustc_type_ir, but doesn't work with private fields and such.

I guess if something may need to be encoded, it shouldn't be private, right?

Not necessarily. Like in my binder refactor branch, the bound vars in Binder are private. But can still be accessed through a function
Right. What I meant was, if it can be accessed through a function, impl in rustc_middle is feasible
Though writing all the impls might be very tedious, even with a macro
Yeah, that's about right

@Jack Huey that is quite useful context. In any case, some sync time will certainly not hurt. I am available all week. It is only the time zone diff that we need to take into account. Is Wed fine for you ?
also is the recording of this meeting available somewhere ? https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/144729-wg-traits/topic/type.20library.20discussion/near/215132957

Wednesday is difficult for me. Are you available Tuesday before or after the meeting?

I'm still available today if you are. Do you want to do a zoom meeting? (I will PM a link to anyone interested in joining)
Note that Zoom is having issues at the moment
Hi there, yes I am! Will be here in 5 minutes/
@detrumi issued like.. it does not work atm ?
It seems to be working fine for me
But we'll see
Possibly, https://status.zoom.us/
alright I am here
@detrumi are you joining?
Yes!
:wave:, I'm back, I see that @Zahari Dichev picked the issue up, @Jack Huey maybe I should just join next meeting again and see where I can be helpful
@Santiago Pastorino I was thinking, its chalk side, but you could add substs to generators
And then do the lowering on rustc side too
Small, but needed

Jack Huey said:

Santiago Pastorino I was thinking, its chalk side, but you could add substs to generators

sure, is there some information/issue or something about that somewhere?
or where should I start?
could probably do so tomorrow
Well, I think I'm misremembering what was needed here:
See chalk#618
Add rustc's representation of Generator/GeneratorWitness: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/b81f5811f96fe750ab28c15219d1b0dba6b1dc90/compiler/rustc_middle/src/ty/sty.rs#L172
And Chalk's: https://github.com/rust-lang/chalk/blob/f693550bd63f5db57a1337a39a8f9a0994dd956a/chalk-ir/src/lib.rs#L764
Maybe it was just Movability that I remember?
Or that Chalk's GeneratorWitness has a Substitution that rustc's does not?
I suppose that the ty list in rustc is replaced by the substitution in chalk
I remember I was having problems doing the lowering
So, maybe it's worth starting there and then adding/changing what you need from chalk to get it to work
